page.title: 06CHELMONDISTON
page.content: Chelmondiston is a small, compact village with a strong community spirit. It has a Post Office, a butcher's, a gift shop, a grocer's, a bric-brac centre, and an art gallery. In Chelmondiston there are two pubs, the Forester's Arms and the Red Lion. Chelmondiston also has a Fish and Chip shop. There are three churches in the village, St. Andrew's C.of E., the Methodist Church and the Baptist Church. The oldest building is probably the Red Lion, which is over 200 years old. Some houses in the village are quite old, but some have been built more recently. There are new bungalows planned for old people. There is a Primary School,a Toddler's group and a Play Group. There are clubs for adults and children. Most of the people who work locally are connected with businesses, boats and farming.
